Job Title: Human Resources Manager

Location: Amarillo, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Human Resources, Strategy/Planning

Description:
Job Description Join our team and play a vital role in supporting the cutting-edge State-of-the-Art Facility in Amarillo, TX. As the HR Manager you will oversee retention, recruiting, onboarding, employee relations, compliance, training, payroll, compensation, safety, and benefits in the plant.
The HR Manager is responsible for specified responsibilities including partnering with multiple plant leaders and teammates at all levels of the Company to help set strategy, lead change, and drive engagement. This is a hands-on business partner role that will work across multiple functional areas and support all areas of HR program delivery including recruiting, employee relations, safety, compensation, training, and compliance.
This position works with plant leaders and teammates at all levels of the Company to help set strategy, lead change, and drive engagement. This is a hands-on leadership role that will work across multiple functional areas and support all areas of HR program delivery including employee relations, total rewards, staffing, safety, organizational development and training, and compliance.
KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES:Provide leadership for Human Resources initiatives.Develop and implement core HR structure for Amarillo plant location.Act as consultant and coach for managers and teammates concerning organizational structures, organizational development, and implementation of change.Work with teammates, supervisors, and managers in one-on-one or in a group setting to effectively coach and counsel on performance and/or interpersonal development needs.Partners with EHS Manager, site leaders, and teammates to drive a zero-incident safety culture.Develop training analysis, recommend training programs, and maintain appropriate records.Advise leaders in appropriate resolution of associate relations issues and be present during disciplinary meetings.Administer performance review program to ensure alignment with strategy, effectiveness, compliance, and equity within organization.Develop, implement, and administer workforce planning models to ensure we have the right people in the right place at the right time.Ensure that we maintain our desired competitive position for compensation by participating in surveys, driving structural reviews, and communicating results.Partner with the benefits team to resolve complicated benefits issues.Conduct exit interviews for evaluative purposes.Develop, update, and communicate company policies.Reporting Relationships:Reports to Director, HR with strong dotted-line relationship to Plant Manager
Required SkillsBuilding trust and credibility - will act as a trusted advisor to associates and leadership.Adaptability: Must be flexible and respond quickly and with a sense of urgencyChange Management: Proven track record in navigating and promoting cultural changes in people, process, and performance.Influencing and Negotiating: Selling the value of the recommended solution as a way of improving organizational performance; gaining commitment to solutions that will improve individual, team, and organizational performance.Business Acumen: Must be able to understand the day-to-day operations of the business and ensures consultation, projects and services delivered address business needs. Must also be able to interpret financial data related to business success measures.Makes sound recommendations: Generates effective, innovative ideas and solutions to problems; offers clients options to achieve desired results and helps clients evaluate alternatives considering fit with desired outcomes.Leadership skills: motivates team towards accomplishing common goals. Promotes teamwork and cohesion with a focus on speed, accuracy, and continuous improvement to drive the results of the company.Communication skills: Effectively translates the company values and culture, strategy, and goals. Able to easily communicate ideas and concepts to all levels within the organization and keep clear alignment with cross functional leadership.Planning: Experienced with developing and executing short and long-term projectsPresentation ability: Able to prepare and deliver training to various levels within the organization.Problem solving: Ability to solve, scale and sustain opportunities that meet financial and procedural expectations. Uses teamwork to maximize the results.
Required ExperienceBachelors degree from a 4-year accredited university; masters degree preferred.7+ years of experience working in a Human Resources Business Partner capacity; preferably in a manufacturing environment.Bi-lingual (Spanish) is highly desired.Strong verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills.Exceptional adherence to detail, efficiency, and accuracy. Takes ownership for results.Good reporting analytics skills with sound knowledge of MS-OfficeStrong team player, able to work effectively with diverse client groups.Strong administrative and organizational skills. Ability to prioritize workload and multi-task effectively while considering future organizational requirements.Ability to work under pressure and assimilate information quickly and accurately.Proactive and self-motivated, customer-focused with a positive attitude. Acts with speed and is decisive in a crisis or other time-sensitive situation.Experience supporting manufacturing and/or warehouse teams and implementing Lean/ Continuous Improvement projects.
 Schedule: Monday - Friday (12pm - 8pm)
At Cacique, eligible teammates receive a comprehensive benefits package which includes medical, dental, vision, life insurance and short-term disability. As well as vacation, sick, holiday pay, birthday day off, 401k with company match, and more!
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state, or local protected class. When we collect your personal information as part of a job application or offer of employment, we do so in accordance with industry standards and best practices and in compliance with applicable privacy laws.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
